TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_200<tab>(-Misija-)During the Third Astral Era, Queen Gunnhildr united the fragmented tribes of the Hrothgar to rise up and drove off the Allagans, eventually going on to found the nation of Bozja.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_201<tab>(-Misija-)It should be noted that Gunnhildr was not her name, but rather a title bestowed to the current monarch of any given age. The common thread connecting all rulers of Bozja is their ability to read the stars. There were others who shared in this ability, but they were said to be the greatest seers of their respective ages.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_202<tab>(-Misija-)They were also said to be great warriors. When doing battle with the Allagans or any other would-be invaders, the queen could always be found commanding from the front lines.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_203<tab>(-Misija-)Alas, Bozja would fall in the wake of the Fourth Umbral Calamity. By some miracle, some few survived and were able to build what we knew as the city-state of Bozja.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_300<tab>(-Misija-)They were the elite guard of the queen, masters of myriad arms and magicks, said to be the greatest warriors of their age.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_301<tab>(-Misija-)Their combat prowess was matched only by their devotion to Queen Gunnhildr. They would not hesitate to give their lives in her service. And, should one of these warriors fall in battle, their holy blade would be passed on to a suitable successor.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_302<tab>(-Misija-)Over time, their title as Gunnhildr's Blades would become synonymous with the gunblade, which gained great renown during the war against the Allagans.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_303<tab>(-Misija-)There is not a Bozjan alive who does not know the tales of their heroism. I have no doubt reforging these weapons will lend us both the strength and resolve we need to succeed.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_400<tab>(-Misija-)With Master Gerolt's help, we have nearly all that is required to reforge the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's guard.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_401<tab>(-Misija-)While it is true the legends of their might are duly inspiring, to simply call them the blades of Gunnhildr would do little to differentiate these new armaments from the weapons of eld. After all, we do not wish to give the impression that the originals have been recovered.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_402<tab>(-Misija-)After much thought, Master Gerolt offered a simple and surprisingly satisfactory suggestion of “Resistance weapons.”

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_403<tab>(-Misija-)He also went on to make a rather curious remark about the steps to be taken in their forging: that these weapons can be enhanced further in accordance with the enemies one faces.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_404<tab>(-Misija-)By the sounds of it, these weapons are never truly complete until their purpose is fulfilled.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_500<tab>(-Misija-)It has been two years since I joined the Resistance. Before then I lived as all Bozjans did─under the harsh rule of the Empire.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_501<tab>(-Misija-)It is the only life I have ever known, though my parents often spoke to me of what they remembered from the days of Bozja's independence.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_502<tab>(-Misija-)Though it was under the auspices of our Garlean oppressors, I was educated in prehistoric archaeology.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_503<tab>(-Misija-)While I am thankful for the opportunities it afforded me, I could not turn a blind eye to the suffering of my people. And so I left to join the Resistance.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_400_504<tab>(-Misija-)It was I who proposed to reforge the fabled weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's guard, and Bajsaljen has chosen to place his faith in my plan. I take heart in knowing all I learned from the Empire will be put to good use.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A20_000_000<tab>About Bozja and the Resistance.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A20_000_001<tab>Gangos.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_200<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Our home rests in the southern reaches of Ilsabard, to the west of Dalmasca.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_201<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Our earliest records─or at least those we have been able to recover─suggest Bozja was founded at some point during the Third Astral Era. The Allagan Empire had reached the height of its power, and several tribes of the Hrothgar came here seeking refuge from their supremacy.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_202<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)It was Queen Gunnhildr who would keep the Allagans at bay. Her radiance would light our path to prosperity, and by her grace was the nation of Bozja founded.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_203<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Alas, the Fourth Umbral Calamity would see the end of her kingdom. But those who survived slowly rebuilt, and Bozja was reborn as a city-state that would coexist with neighboring nations for centuries to come.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_204<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)The Garlean Empire's rise to power changed everything. None could oppose the sheer strength and versatility of their military.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_205<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Their campaign began some fifty years ago, and now an entire generation of our people has been raised knowing only oppression. But now they would know freedom.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_206<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)When word reached us that Ala Mhigo and Doma had risen up to defy the Empire, we seized the opportunity to flee and form pockets of resistance.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_225<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)We have come a long way in our fight against the imperials, thanks in no small part to Blade <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 03 /var>. Why, without <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> timely assistance, the revival of Gunnhildr's Blades would have been little more than a dream.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_226<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)And with our forces consolidated, we were able to force back the IVth Legion, affording us the opportunity to seize Castrum Lacus Litore.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_230<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Though Queen Gunnhildr no longer poses a threat, we will be hard-pressed to overcome the imperials' reinforcements. But we mustn't give in to despair. To do so would be a dishonor to those who laid down their lives for the future of Bozja.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_300<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)For the present, this is our base of operations, to the southeast of what remains of Bozja Citadel. When the fighting begins, we will hold the line here.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_301<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)For a blessing, the surrounding wetlands and the fog that persists year-round have served to conceal our operation. That is not to say, of course, we have not taken additional measures to remain hidden.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_302<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)In the unlikely event that their scouts should approach the perimeter, our mages have cast a cloaking spell around the area to keep us from sight.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_303<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Havens such as this are plentiful along the southern coast of Ilsabard. Our facilities are rather modest, I confess, but I would like to think we have made great strides in providing for our soldiers here.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_400<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)It was roughly twenty years ago, if I'm not mistaken. The Empire, fearful of the threat posed by primals and the tribes who summoned them, devised a plan to wipe them out.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_401<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)The Meteor project. Through the use of magitek, they intended to recreate ancient sorcery capable of calling down meteors.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_402<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)At the helm of the project was their chief engineer, Midas nan Garlond. In time, every last one of their research facilities was involved in its development.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_403<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)The project would take a perilous turn when it was discovered that the lesser moon Dalamud was, in fact, a satellite of Allagan design. They were determined to make it part of their plans.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_404<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)And so they erected a colossal transmission tower, designed to control Dalamud. Its first test would also prove to be its last...

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_405<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)For lack of eyewitnesses, what happened next is difficult to describe. It is often described as an explosion, but the ruins showed no signs of gunpowder or magic. We only know that a terrible light shone from the heavens that night.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_406<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)In an instant, the citadel was gone. Its citizens and soldiers...my family...

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_101_407<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)It is a terrifying thought that Bahamut is the reason Dalamud responded with such destructive force, but needless to say, all work on the Meteor project was halted immediately.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_408<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Five years later, however, Nael van Darnus set the wheels of the project back into motion. His devotion was rewarded with the coming of the Seventh Umbral Calamity.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_409<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)The world has already paid too great a cost for the Garleans' ambition... They must be stopped.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_430<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)As you know, Queen Gunnhildr was protected by an elite guard known as Gunnhildr's Blades. Their title would one day lend itself to the most renowned of their weaponry─the gunblade, but each of her guard was said to have mastered a unique weapon.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_431<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)These blades were said to be blessed by the gods, and in the unlikely event one of the queen's guard should fall in battle, their weapon was passed on to a suitable successor.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_432<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)When Lord Hien suggested we find a symbol our people might rally behind, we were admittedly at a loss. For lack of a living figurehead, we looked to the past, and there we found our answer─the blades of Gunnhildr.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_433<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)It was a simple solution, in principle, but without the help of Blade <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 03 /var>, and that of Mikoto and Master Gerolt, we never could have succeeded. I believe I speak for all of us when I say we are eternally grateful for what <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> has done.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_434<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)With the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr forged anew, we then bestowed them upon our finest soldiers. Indeed, the illustrious Gunnhildr's Blades have been reborn.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_450<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)I was so certain our plan would succeed... But who could have foreseen Queen Gunnhildr herself being turned against us? Our soldiers, Gunnhildr's Blades, made her slaves.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_451<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)It was indeed a heavy blow to morale, but I know they would not want us to mourn their passing. As was tradition in the days of old, we must find capable soldiers to carry on in their stead, and press onward. Come what may, Bozja will be freed from the Empire.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_500<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)I was born in Bozja, though I have never known a life free from the Empire's rule.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_501<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Following in my late father's footsteps, I studied to become a doctor. Much to my surprise, and dismay, my academic accomplishments did not go unnoticed. I was taken to the capital, where I received a formal education in medicinal sciences. Deployment as a medic in their military soon followed.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_502<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)My service was ultimately rewarded with citizenship, after which I met my wife, and we started a family together. If their goal was for me to grow content and complacent, it failed, for not a day went by that I did not think about the liberation of my homeland.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_503<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)But I would need to bide my time a while longer, for I was assigned to the IVth Imperial Legion. There was an uprising in Nagxia, and it fell to us to quell their insurrection. It was not until after our mission was complete that I learned of what happened to Bozja. To my family...
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_504<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)We returned as fast as we were able, but there was nothing left of the citadel.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_505<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)I was ordered to return to the capital, but I had to find my wife and children. I covered every ilm of that barren wasteland...and nothing.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_506<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Chains and a prison cell greeted me back in Garlemald, but in spite of my confinement, whispers of what happened in Bozja eventually reached me. Of their failed experiments to control Dalamud.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_507<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Stripped of my citizenship, I expected to remain under lock and key until the end of my days. Fortunately for me, they had need of more medics for their next campaign.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_508<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)But I would never reach the battlefield, for I escaped with a number of other soldiers to join the Resistance.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BAISHAEN_100_509<tab>(-Bajsaljen-)Many years of service to the Resistance then molded me into the man I am today. And I will continue to serve for as long as it takes to see our homeland safe from the Empire.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A30_000_000<tab>About the IVth Imperial Legion.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A30_000_001<tab>About Legatus Noah van Gabranth.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A30_000_002<tab>About Castrum Lacus Litore.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A30_100_002<tab>About Menenius sas Lanatus.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A30_000_003<tab>About Marsak.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A30_000_004<tab>About Misija.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A30_000_0010<tab>Return.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_200<tab>(-Marsak-)The initial invasion of Bozja was led by Basch van Gabranth. There would be a change of commander not long after, however.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_201<tab>(-Marsak-)Thirty years ago, during the invasion of Dalmasca, his health took an unexpected turn for the worse, and his son, Noah van Gabranth, oversaw the conquest to its completion. He was a mere twenty years old when he assumed full command.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_202<tab>(-Marsak-)The IVth Imperial Legion itself is rather unique compared to most, for the bulk of their forces are not native Garleans, their present leader included.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_203<tab>(-Marsak-)Both Noah and his father were quite quick to bend the knee to Emperor Solus, from what I have been told. Perhaps it was that ardent loyalty that helped them rise to such prominence.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_204<tab>(-Marsak-)But not all were such fervent followers of the Empire. Quite the contrary, I would hazard the greater part of their soldiers were like us, seeing little recourse but to serve lest they be put to the sword.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_205<tab>(-Marsak-)Though I suppose the unwavering loyalty of the IVth Imperial Legion is what serves to set it apart from the rest. Or to be more precise, its loyalty to Noah van Gabranth.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_206<tab>(-Marsak-)What's more, they are not wont to rely on magitek armaments like most imperial soldiers.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_207<tab>(-Marsak-)Indeed, they seem to prefer fighting the old-fashioned way, employing arcane magicks, techniques akin to summoning, and all manner of feral beasts rather than depending on heavy artillery.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_220<tab>(-Marsak-)The IVth Legion's remaining forces are being led by Menenius, allowing Lyon to freely roam the southern front as he pleases.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_221<tab>(-Marsak-)And, of course, there is Misija. It will be quite some time before we recover from the losses her betrayal has caused us.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_300<tab>(-Marsak-)Ah yes, the leader of the IVth Imperial Legion, one of the youngest to ever take such a position. His father, Basch van Gabranth, served as legatus before him, claiming many a victory in the name of the Empire.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_301<tab>(-Marsak-)Basch was a knight of the Republic of Landis, which, like so many other nations, was fast to fall at the hands of the Empire. Rather than die with dignity, he was quite quick to bend the knee to their conquerors, ingratiating himself with the Emperor and earning his place as a legatus.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_302<tab>(-Marsak-)This was quite a feat, given that he was not of Garlean blood. One can but imagine the lengths to which he went to earn their trust, but it is clear he labored hard to keep it.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_303<tab>(-Marsak-)His health took an unexpected turn for the worse during the invasion of Dalmasca, which afforded Noah the opportunity he needed to rise to prominence. And it was under Noah's leadership that Rabanastre would fall.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_304<tab>(-Marsak-)Then, when his father passed two years later, he was named the next legatus of the IVth Imperial Legion.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_305<tab>(-Marsak-)Many believe it was the conquest of Dalmasca that earned him the position, but some argue he was appointed on the recommendation of the Emperor, perhaps in recognition of his father's service to the Empire.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_306<tab>(-Marsak-)Regardless of the reason, Noah would continue in his father's footsteps. The IVth Imperial Legion would continue to be comprised primarily of foreign soldiers, and their loyalty to the newly appointed legatus was unfaltering.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_307<tab>(-Marsak-)One might expect such a legion to remain within the Emperor's good graces, but it would not be so when Varis took the throne. For several years he appointed them to the quelling of uprisings in remote provinces, as if to keep them at arm's length.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_308<tab>(-Marsak-)Perhaps he suspected an ulterior motive to the Gabranths seeking to gain such fervent adoration from the IVth Imperial Legion. I have no proof, of course, but one cannot help but wonder...

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_400<tab>(-Marsak-)It was once known as Alermuc Fortress, erected in the hopes of deterring the Garleans. After the Bozja incident, it would be rebuilt and given a new name─Castrum Lacus Litore.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_401<tab>(-Marsak-)Its position to the north of Bozja will make it a critical strategic point in the battles to come. If we are to have any hope of reclaiming Bozja, we must first gain control of the castrum.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_402<tab>(-Marsak-)The location was originally chosen for its natural defenses. Being surrounded on all sides by steep cliffs made Alermuc Fortress all but impregnable. Assuming, of course, one had the wherewithal to defend it.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_403<tab>(-Marsak-)When the Garleans came, their magitek weaponry was unlike anything we had ever seen. A great many lives were lost in our struggle to hold the fortress, and in the end we were simply outmatched.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_415<tab>(-Marsak-)Our plan to retake the castrum seemed without fault, and was executed to the letter. If not for Misija, we would likely be having this conversation there rather than here.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_416<tab>(-Marsak-)So many lives have been lost to her treachery...

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_417<tab>(-Marsak-)My only solace is in the knowledge that Menenius has withdrawn from the castrum. With its defense systems no longer functioning, I suspect he fears heavier losses should we launch another assault.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_450<tab>(-Marsak-)At present, the castrum is held by Legatus Gabranth's second-in-command, Menenius rem Lanatus, or I suppose I should say Menenius sas Lanatus, if our intelligence is to be believed. It would appear he was recently promoted to commanding officer of the legion's forces.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_451<tab>(-Marsak-)Lanatus is a well-known family with a long and august lineage. That is, until they incurred the ire of the Emperor, tarnishing their name and robbing them of their position in Garlean society.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_452<tab>(-Marsak-)And yet Basch van Gabranth would choose members of their family to serve under him. Mayhap he sensed their desperation to redeem their honor. If that is the case, the road to redemption is long indeed, for two generations of Lanatus have served under the Gabranths.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_453<tab>(-Marsak-)A curious state of affairs considering the information recently pried from one of our prisoners. If they are to be believed, Menenius is not of Garlean descent─he is an Elezen. Adoption of a non-Garlean by nobles is unprecedented.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_454<tab>(-Marsak-)Only the gods know what inexplicable twist of fate would drive them to do such a thing, but I can understand why they would remain at the side of one who seeks the discarded and otherwise undesirable.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_455<tab>(-Marsak-)Menenius serves as their chief intelligence officer, and as one might imagine, the greater part of his time is spent recruiting and dispatching spies, plotting how best to subvert their enemies.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_456<tab>(-Marsak-)It yet remains to be seen if Misija was a spy from the start, or if they persuaded her to turn against us, but I have no doubt that what has happened was all according to his plans.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_457<tab>(-Marsak-)What I find more concerning, however, is how they are still able to recruit more soldiers to their cause with their empty promises of a new nation.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_458<tab>(-Marsak-)We would do well not to underestimate them. There is no telling what they may attempt next to thwart us.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_500<tab>(-Marsak-)I serve primarily as liaison 'twixt the Bozjan Resistance and our allies. I'll not deny there is still much for me to learn, but I will do everything within my power to see Bozja free of the Empire. If that should mean my life, then so be it.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_501<tab>(-Marsak-)...My past? It is no different than most, I would imagine─conscription by the Empire, which is the only reason I was not present in the citadel to die alongside my kin in the Bozja incident.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_502<tab>(-Marsak-)Some would call it a massacre planned by the Empire, but I am not ready to believe they would willingly kill so many of their own soldiers and engineers.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_503<tab>(-Marsak-)Having been raised under the Garlean doctrine, I realize that not all of them are the bloodthirsty monsters many of us would paint them to be. Though the Empire would seek to oppress us, I do not share the same animosity towards its citizens as my Resistance comrades.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_504<tab>(-Marsak-)But these are musings better left unspoken. I would not have the others think me a coward or a traitor to our cause.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_605<tab>(-Marsak-)Despite what few resources we have to spare, Bajsaljen has carried out an investigation into Misija and her past. The results were...not what we expected.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_606<tab>(-Marsak-)We could find absolutely no inconsistencies in her family or military records. One might say she was lying with the truth.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_607<tab>(-Marsak-)From the first, she was one of us. A woman of Bozja... And despite everything that has happened, I believe she is still one of us.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_608<tab>(-Marsak-)<sigh> No doubt she would say such naivety is what cost the lives of so many.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_615<tab>(-Marsak-)There is so much blood on her hands, and yet I still cannot find it within me to hate her.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_616<tab>(-Marsak-)For the interim she will remain in our gaol underground, a guard watching her cell at all times, lest someone seize an opportunity to do her harm.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_617<tab>(-Marsak-)Under Bajsaljen's orders, she will face trial after the imperials have been dealt with. I cannot say I agree with his decision to wait, but it is not mine to make.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MARSHAK_200_618<tab>(-Marsak-)Until then, I thought perhaps she might be willing to speak with us, offer intelligence on the enemy to gain some modicum of leniency in her sentencing. Alas, she refuses to talk.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A40_000_000<tab>About the seers.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A40_000_001<tab>About the crystal focus.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A40_000_002<tab>About memory exploration.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A40_000_003<tab>About Mikoto's gift.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A40_100_003<tab>About Save the Queen.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A40_101_003<tab>About tempering.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A40_000_004<tab>About Mikoto.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A40_000_0010<tab>Return.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_200<tab>(-Mikoto-)Scant though they are, the records we have uncovered thus far suggest the practices of seers date back as far as the Fourth Astral Era.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_201<tab>(-Mikoto-)The region was plagued with all manner of natural disasters in those days, inciting great unrest not only amongst the Bozjans, but neighboring nations as well.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_202<tab>(-Mikoto-)It was during these tumultuous times seers first appeared. In fact, I have reason to believe they possessed the Echo.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_203<tab>(-Mikoto-)Using a crystal focus, they were able to delve into the minds of the downcast and the heartsick, seeking out their darkest memories and altering them to ease the peoples' burdens.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_204<tab>(-Mikoto-)Perhaps they saw the altering of minds as a necessity for their survival, but we must consider the ethical implications of such methods in this day and age. I have no doubt my betters in Sharlayan would consider it to be reprehensible.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_300<tab>(-Mikoto-)My initial analysis of the crystals suggests they are man-made. Nothing in my data can prove the materials are unique to this region, which leads me to believe the Bozjans─or rather, the seers─created them.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_301<tab>(-Mikoto-)However, given the intricate lattices found in these crystals, it seems highly improbable that the Bozjans could have produced them, considering the methods available to them in the Fourth Astral Era.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_302<tab>(-Mikoto-)In fact, on closer inspection, it became clear that its structure is quite similar to that found in Allagan constructs.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_303<tab>(-Mikoto-)Which then begs the question: who were the seers, and whence did they come? This is but a working theory, but I suspect their roots can be traced back to the Allagans themselves─perhaps survivors of the Fourth Umbral Calamity who wished to atone for the sins of their forebears.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_304<tab>(-Mikoto-)They came to these lands seeking a means to help the Bozjans, and in doing so created these crystal foci.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_305<tab>(-Mikoto-)...Ahem. As I said, 'tis but a working theory. Though I understand if it sounds more like a flight of fancy.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_400<tab>(-Mikoto-)Perhaps I should start with a simple explanation, as I did before. Let us consider the composition of a person's aether, shall we? There is corporeal aether of the flesh, incorporeal aether of the soul, and the aetherial residue of an individual's memories.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_401<tab>(-Mikoto-)Were one to be possessed of only corporeal aether, they would be but a walking corpse. Conversely, entities comprised of only incorporeal aether are referred to in layman's terms as ghosts. Of course, a ghost that possesses residual memories could likely recall its past and retain self-awareness.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_402<tab>(-Mikoto-)Using a crystal focus, we can isolate the aetherial signature of memories, much in the same way the seers did. We can then delve into and explore specific memories conjured by the subject.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_403<tab>(-Mikoto-)We must be careful of what we observe, however, for while the information stored in a person's memories can be quite comprehensive, it is not always true to fact. They can be distorted due to the passage of time, or even when first committed to the mind as a result of personal bias.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_404<tab>(-Mikoto-)That is why it is important to mark the distinction between explicit and implicit memories.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_405<tab>(-Mikoto-)Explicit memories are those consciously stored and recalled, while implicit memories are more passively accumulated by our subconscious.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_406<tab>(-Mikoto-)When meeting someone for the first time, their appearance will be kept as part of our explicit memory, though this may fade with the passing of time. Should a great deal of time pass without meeting, however, such recollection can prove difficult.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_407<tab>(-Mikoto-)Yet in that moment, your mind also takes record of everything experienced by your sensory nervous system.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_408<tab>(-Mikoto-)Unfortunately, information called from explicit memory is quite sensitive to misrepresentations of events. After all, if an individual is actively choosing to recall an event, who is to say they will not make alterations to better suit their liking?

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_409<tab>(-Mikoto-)That is why we seek information from implicit memory, which is more likely to be preserved free of the bias of an individual's worldview.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_500<tab>(-Mikoto-)The Echo can manifest itself in myriad ways dependent on the individual. I was gifted with the ability to peer into the future.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_501<tab>(-Mikoto-)It is a power much like prophetic dreams and divinations, and yet quite different, for such visions only tell of the future's potential.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_502<tab>(-Mikoto-)The Echo does not show me what may happen, but what <var 1A 02 /var>will<var 1A 01 /var> happen.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_503<tab>(-Mikoto-)Scholars speculate Mezaya Thousand Eyes too shared this gift, hence the alarming accuracy of the passages writ in her <var 1A 02 /var>Divine Chronicles<var 1A 01 /var>.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_504<tab>(-Mikoto-)These visions are a decidedly rare occurrence, usually containing some crucial insight into matters presently unfolding before me. For better or worse, I have never had visions of an impending threat on my life or those around me.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_505<tab>(-Mikoto-)Not that I would want to see such things, of course. Could you imagine, knowing of certain doom that cannot be avoided?

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_506<tab>(-Mikoto-)I once spoke of my visions to an acquaintance─a relatively harmless glimpse of the future─and it resulted in a terrible argument. I fear I could not bear the weight of grimmer tidings...
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_507<tab>(-Mikoto-)But that is neither here nor there. My gift is but a trivial thing. Nothing anyone should think to rely upon.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_520<tab>(-Mikoto-)Legend has it that, when the Fourth Umbral Calamity threatened to destroy all of Bozja, Queen Gunnhildr used the power of her holy blade, Save the Queen, to save her people.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_521<tab>(-Mikoto-)Misija called it a primal summoning, claiming the queen was able to control its power much like Lady Ysayle harnessed the power of Shiva.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_522<tab>(-Mikoto-)The apparition we saw in the memory assumed the form of what I presume was Queen Gunnhildr, the entity Misija summoned adopting the same appearance.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_523<tab>(-Mikoto-)As to why it would take such a form, I believe it is linked to the nature of Queen Gunnhildr's death at the hands of her guard.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_524<tab>(-Mikoto-)This is but a theory, mind, but if the residual aether of her memories was absorbed by the blade, it stands to reason Save the Queen could gain some semblance of sentience.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_525<tab>(-Mikoto-)Curious that Misija was somehow able to control it. I can only assume this was made possible through our shared use of the crystal focus.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_535<tab>(-Mikoto-)A pity it was destroyed, though I suppose it is for the best. We are ill-suited to using it as the seers of eld did, and now the spirit of Queen Gunnhildr can never again be manipulated for nefarious ends.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_536<tab>(-Mikoto-)Even so, as long as Save the Queen exists, there remains the risk of its power being abused.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_537<tab>(-Mikoto-)But I wonder... Could the aether which comprised the queen's memories still reside in the blade? Without the crystal focus, perhaps we will never know.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_540<tab>(-Mikoto-)I believe the term was coined after confrontations with the primal Ifrit. The creature would bombard its enemies with a veritable deluge of aether, rendering them mindless slaves.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_541<tab>(-Mikoto-)Though perhaps it would be more accurate to say their will is supplanted by that of the primal. They will act instinctively according to its whims and desires, no matter how depraved or immoral.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_301_542<tab>(-Mikoto-)The effect was believed to be irreversible, but the Scions are said to have discovered a cure. I imagine it will not be long before the method of treatment is shared with the Resistance.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_545<tab>(-Mikoto-)Thankfully the Warrior of Light and I are gifted with the Echo, otherwise the queen would likely bid us join the ranks of the afflicted.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_550<tab>(-Mikoto-)We can only hope the treatment for tempering reaches us before those affected are irreparably altered. Of course, there is also the matter of seeing to their capture.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_551<tab>(-Mikoto-)If Bajsaljen should ask for my counsel on the matter, I am honestly at a loss as to what to say. If my negligence should cost more lives in apprehending Gunnhildr's Blades and the other afflicted... It pains me to even imagine it.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_600<tab>(-Mikoto-)Oh, there really isn't much to tell, I assure you!

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_601<tab>(-Mikoto-)Well, if you must know... Due to advanced placement I found myself attending the Studium much earlier than most. My research in the field of aetherology would eventually earn me the title of Archon. When I am not conducting research in the field, I conduct lectures at the Studium.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_602<tab>(-Mikoto-)Moenbryda is, er...was...my mentor. I would not be the scholar I am today if not for her. I have fond memories of the many nights we toiled together working on her original plans for the aetheric siphon. She was like a sister to me.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_603<tab>(-Mikoto-)Speaking of which, I do have a sister, actually. An identical twin, in fact. Though we have not spoken since she too was named an Archon.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_604<tab>(-Mikoto-)She was my better in all aspects of academia, but she often disagreed with the views of the Forum. I can but assume that is why she took her leave of the Studium.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_605<tab>(-Mikoto-)She was always so strong-willed and quite critical of those around her. Sadly, we never got along very well growing up. I often wonder if that is why Moenbryda was so quick to take me under her wing.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_606<tab>(-Mikoto-)I still see her, in my dreams. Always offering a warm smile and words of encouragement.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_MIKOTO_300_607<tab>(-Mikoto-)If we were to use the crystal focus, perhaps there would be a way to speak with her again. A tempting prospect, but in the end, I know it would not truly be her...
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A50_000_000<tab>About the aether spectrometer.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A50_000_001<tab>About the recording drone.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A50_000_002<tab>About Lilja.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A50_000_003<tab>About the barriers.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A50_000_004<tab>About the defluxion aether manipulators.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A50_000_0010<tab>Return.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_000<tab>(-Lilja-)The aether spectrometer? Well, seeing as I haven't read the manual, you'll have to settle for a brief explanation. Hopefully Jessie doesn't hear about this.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_001<tab>(-Lilja-)Ahem. The idea for it originally came from Mikoto, and the chief─genius that he is─was able to put her ideas to paper. After that, all it took was a little ingenuity from our engineers to bring everything together.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_002<tab>(-Lilja-)After the sensors are in place and turned on, they analyze the aether currents running through the area, and that data is tracked by our monitors here.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_003<tab>(-Lilja-)What makes it so invaluable to our plans is its ability to distinguish between varying aetherial signatures. The large aether currents we're tracking are like giant rivers fed by streams of different kinds of aether. But with the spectrometer, we can easily pick out the specific one we need. Fascinating stuff, isn't it?

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_100<tab>(-Lilja-)The what? Oh, right. The chief picked it up on one of his scavenging trips to Allagan ruins somewhere. It's been surprisingly nice to have around. Goodness knows I can't keep track of everything going on here.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_101<tab>(-Lilja-)Jessie asked that I keep it on at all times. If I'm to be honest, though, I think she just wants to keep a close eye on me. Whether that's a good or a bad thing, I'm not sure.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_200<tab>(-Lilja-)M-Me!? But I... Why would anyone want to know about me?

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_201<tab>(-Lilja-)Can't imagine I have many common interests with most people. I'd make for terrible company, especially with someone as worldly as the savior of Eorzea, while I'm just a... Oh gods...

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_SYSTEM_100_202<tab>While there is no further audio for this data entry, it appears the drone noted elevated heart rate and body temperature shortly before the recording ended.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_300<tab>(-Lilja-)The chief came up with the idea after the Dalmascan resistance consulted him on ideas to protect their outposts. In ancient times, certain cities and strongholds there were protected by magicked barriers said to reach up to the heavens.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_301<tab>(-Lilja-)I'm told the mages performed rather complicated rites to do it, but it basically boiled down to enchanting crystals with protection spells.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_302<tab>(-Lilja-)Of course, the greater the area covered, the more crystals they required. What's more, in a case such as ours, a veritable army of mages chanting incantations around the clock would be required.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_303<tab>(-Lilja-)The Dalmascan resistance thought magitek might be able to replicate the effect, and so they called on the chief to hopefully work something out.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_304<tab>(-Lilja-)The first thing that came to mind was Seiryu's Wall in the Burn: a device that could erect a barrier over a given space using the ambient aether flowing in the ground beneath it.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_305<tab>(-Lilja-)It was agreed that Bozja had the more pressing need, and so the chief brought his new shielding technology here first. It's on a much smaller scale than Seiryu's Wall, mind, but it certainly does the job.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_306<tab>(-Lilja-)When building them in Dalmasca, I do hope he remembers that not every land has been suffused with unnaturally high stores of energy like Bozja. Though I shouldn't be worried. This is the chief we're talking about, after all.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_309<tab>(-Lilja-)At any rate, that's why we have barriers protecting all the outposts out here.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_400<tab>(-Lilja-)Gosh, it's so exciting seeing one of my inventions put to such good use. It certainly wasn't easy coming up with something to handle such delicate work while also tough enough to survive on the battlefield.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_401<tab>(-Lilja-)It's a wonder we didn't need them when we first came to the southern front. You'd be surprised at how many aether currents are either too small to be of use, or too fragmented to carry a steady stream of aether.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_402<tab>(-Lilja-)That's where the defluxion aether manipulators come in!
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_LILJA_100_403<tab>(-Lilja-)There's nothing more motivating than praise from the chief. I can't wait for another chance to show off my engineering know-how.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A60_000_000<tab>About the situation in Dalmasca.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A60_000_001<tab>About Bwagi.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A60_000_002<tab>About the Bangaa.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A60_000_003<tab>About the <var 1A 02 /var>Ia'sar<var 1A 01 /var>.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_A60_000_0010<tab>Return.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_000<tab>(-Bwagi-)Dalmasca? That's precisely why I'm here. Lady Fran asked that I relay the news to Bajsaljen. What I have to say is meant only for his ears, but I suppose she wouldn't be cross if Eorzea's champion were to hear as well.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_001<tab>(-Bwagi-)The resistance forces in Dalmasca and Nagxia have been planning assaults of their own to coincide with the Bozjan's strike on the castrum here.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_002<tab>(-Bwagi-)In Dalmasca their target was Castrum Amicitia, known to most as the nigh-impenetrable Nalbina Fortress. Their losses were great, but in the end their efforts were rewarded with victory.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_003<tab>(-Bwagi-)In Nagxia they succeeded in taking a port to cut off their supply chain. The IVth Legion was surprisingly quick to turn tail from what I've been told.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_004<tab>(-Bwagi-)The forces in both Dalmasca and Nagxia are overjoyed by their success, but Lady Fran suspects something is amiss. She believes victory should not have been so easily won against the IVth Legion.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_005<tab>(-Bwagi-)To that end, we have begun tracking their activity more closely. And considering the state of affairs in the Empire, we found it curious there has been little to or from their base of operations in Valnain.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_006<tab>(-Bwagi-)After the death of Lord Varis, it would be an understatement to say the Empire fell into disarray. It's a war of factions in the truest sense of the word.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_007<tab>(-Bwagi-)According to our intelligence, the IVth Legion has been ordered to return to the imperial capital, but Gabranth has refused. He's since proclaimed that Dalmasca will be the site of a new nation he intends to build.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_008<tab>(-Bwagi-)Sounds to me like if he means to continue his fight for Bozja, the IVth Legion will be doing it alone.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_009<tab>(-Bwagi-)There may never be a more prime opportunity than now to defeat them. There's a growing call to strike, and I'm inclined to agree that we should. But Lady Fran insisted we wait until we better understood the IVth Legion's goal.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_010<tab>(-Bwagi-)She had hoped the Bozjan's conflict with Gabranth's forces might shed some light on their motives, and it seems her suspicions were well founded.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_015<tab>(-Bwagi-)Our allies in Dalmasca and Nagxia will be pleased to hear of the Resistance's victories over the imperials thus far. It would not surprise me if the news did not embolden them to hasten their plans to take the offensive.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_016<tab>(-Bwagi-)Would that we could discern what Gabranth is after here, though. Lady Fran was convinced they would retreat from Bozja, and the loss of Save the Queen only gives them greater cause to fall back.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_017<tab>(-Bwagi-)Instead they bring an imperial warship. But why? What could they possibly hope to gain by remaining here?
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_100<tab>(-Bwagi-)Me? What's there to tell? A former fusilier to the royal family working with the Resistance against our common enemy─the IVth Legion.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_100_101<tab>(-Bwagi-)For now, I serve as liaison for Lady Fran. I can already tell there will be much to speak of when I return to Dalmasca.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_000<tab>(-Bwagi-)About the Bangaa? I would have thought you had more pressing matters to attend to. Though I suppose my people are an unfamiliar sight to you Eorzeans. Very well...
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_001<tab>(-Bwagi-)To start, it should be noted that we Bangaa are mammals, not reptiles. A common misconception due to our scaly appearance.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_002<tab>(-Bwagi-)I say “scaly,” but these are not, in fact, scales on our skin. When our fur sheds, scant though it may be, patches of it do not grow back. Instead, the skin grows callous and hardens into scalelike patterns.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_003<tab>(-Bwagi-)...What? Is what I'm saying truly so surprising? I suppose you also thought we were born from eggs as well. I will forgive you for your ignorance, if only this once. My brethren would certainly have more than a few choice words to share.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_004<tab>(-Bwagi-)Ahem, now where was I? Ah, yes. We Bangaa are also quite long-lived. On average, I would say we live twice as long as the average Hyur.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_005<tab>(-Bwagi-)We mature by the age of fifteen, shedding our skin once a year. Shedding becomes less frequent after that, occurring once every four to─ ...There's that look again. I know what you're thinking, and I swear to the Twelve if the word “lizard” escapes your lips I will not think twice about cutting them off.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_006<tab>(-Bwagi-)As I was saying, we Bangaa are perhaps known best for our superior sense of smell and hearing, as well as our physical prowess. Our greatest weakness, I am embarrassed to say, lies with our voices.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_007<tab>(-Bwagi-)To be more precise, it is the unique structure of our vocal cords. It makes the incantation of spells rather difficult for us, which is why Bangaa practitioners of magic are exceedingly rare.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_008<tab>(-Bwagi-)Hmmm... What else? There was once a time you could distinguish between clansmen by the color of their skin, but after many years of intermingling such distinctions have become meaningless. Nevertheless, one can never be too mindful.
TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_009<tab>(-Bwagi-)The Ruga are known to have yellow-brown skin, the Faas have bronze skin, the Bista have red-brown skin, and the Sanga have ash grey skin.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_200_010<tab>(-Bwagi-)That should suffice, I think. Consider yourself duly educated on the Bangaa. If you should remember anything, I pray it is what <var 1A 02 /var>not<var 1A 01 /var> to call us.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_300_000<tab>(-Bwagi-)Have you never seen the <var 1A 02 /var>Ia'sar<var 1A 01 /var> before? She was once used to pilot Eorzea's champion to meet with Lady Fran in Rabanastre. You would be hard-pressed to find a finer vessel.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_300_001<tab>(-Bwagi-)At any rate, we─or rather, my dear brother Ba'Gamnan─first commandeered the ship from the wealthy elite of Ul'dah. After a few modifications by myself and Rinok, I daresay it's the fastest airship to ever grace the skies.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_300_002<tab>(-Bwagi-)And so we christened her the <var 1A 02 /var>Ia'sar<var 1A 01 /var>, meaning “tornado” in the old Dalmascan tongue. Funnily enough, it is a name often given to unruly horses. I can assure you our airship is anything but, so long as you have a delicate touch.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_300_003<tab>(-Bwagi-)We've grown quite attached to her over the years. Through our highs and lows, the <var 1A 02 /var>Ia'sar<var 1A 01 /var> has always been there with us. Why, one might say we think of her as family.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_300_004<tab>(-Bwagi-)We were admittedly apprehensive when first joining the Dalmascan resistance, fearing we would have to part with our airship, but Lady Fran made sure that would not be the case.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_300_005<tab>(-Bwagi-)If anything should happen to the <var 1A 02 /var>Ia'sar<var 1A 01 /var> here in Bozja, though, I will not mourn her. Having served us so faithfully all these years, I can think of no finer opportunity for her to take her final flight.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_300_006<tab>(-Bwagi-)“He who fights the river's flow knows naught of the ocean.” An old Dalmascan proverb to remind us that those who tug against the threads of fate often fail to see the tapestry woven by our lives.

TEXT_REGOTH4MYCSTORAGESYSTEM_00692_BWAGI_300_007<tab>(-Bwagi-)I believe there is a greater purpose to all that we do, and if fate would have me here, fighting alongside you, then I will not struggle against the river's flow.
